io.github.samwright.framework.model.common

Interface Replaceable

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    Element, Processor, TopProcessor, Workflow, WorkflowContainer
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractElement, AbstractProcessor, AbstractWorkflow, AbstractWorkflowContainer, Adder, ChooserWorkflowContainer, ContourFinder, ExContainer, FingertipFinder, FingertipReducer, HandDetector, ImageLoader, KeyboardActor, MockElement, NNClassifier, Optimiser, PalmDetector, SimplifyContour, SkinDetector, SplitJoinWorkflowContainer, StartElement, StaticColourRange, TopWorkflowContainer, Viewer, WorkflowImpl

    public interface Replaceable
    An object that can be replaced by another (or deleted), whilst keeping track of earlier and later versions.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void afterReplacement()
      This is called after all relevant objects have been fixed, and presents the implementing class with the opportunity to perform last-minute changes to itself now that all related objects have also been fixed.
      boolean isReplacing()
      Returns true iff this object is currently replacing another.
      void replace(Replaceable toReplace)
      Propose that this object replace the supplied object.
      void replaceWith(Replaceable replacement)
      Propose a replacement for this object.

    • Method Detail

      • replaceWith

        void replaceWith(Replaceable replacement)
        Propose a replacement for this object. How this is handled is determined by the concrete class implementing this.

        This must have no next version, and the replacement must have no previous version - otherwise a RuntimeException is thrown.

        As an example, a sequence of versions between Replaceable objects start and end can be contracted using 

        start.discardNext();  // start.getNext() == null
 end.discardPrevious(); // end.getPrevious() == null
 start.replaceWith(end);
        Parameters:
        replacement - the replacement to propose.
        Throws:
        RuntimeException - if this object is still mutable, or has already been replaced or deleted.

      • replace

        void replace(Replaceable toReplace)
        Propose that this object replace the supplied object. If the given object is null, this becomes the start of a new line of objects.
        Parameters:
        toReplace - the object to replace.

      • afterReplacement

        void afterReplacement()
        This is called after all relevant objects have been fixed, and presents the implementing class with the opportunity to perform last-minute changes to itself now that all related objects have also been fixed.

      • isReplacing

        boolean isReplacing()
        Returns true iff this object is currently replacing another.
        Returns:
        true iff this object is currently replacing another.
